Education & Robotics Workshops

Building computational thinking and real-world projects

Key Stage 3: Foundations

  • Computational Abstractions
    Model real-world systems (e.g., greenhouse sensors measuring temperature & humidity)
  • Programming Languages
    Block programming, flowcharts, pseudocode, and Python
  • Modular Design
    Break problems into functions/procedures and assemble via algorithms
  • Boolean Logic
    Apply AND, OR, NOT decisions and reinforce with logic gates
  • Hardware & Software
    Understand components (sensors, microcontrollers, software) and communication

Key Stage 4: Advancement

  • Deepen Expertise
    Develop creativity and knowledge in CS, digital media, and IT
  • Analytic & Problem-Solving
    Use computational thinking and design skills for complex challenges
  • Data & Cloud Tools
    Analyze with spreadsheets, build dashboards, and leverage cloud platforms
  • Career Preparation
    Gain skills to progress to higher education or professional roles
